newsitem.title: USA: Marathon sees Sakhalin reserve boost.
newsitem.headline: Marathon sees Sakhalin reserve boost.

text.p: Marathon Oil Co expects its 30 percent of Siveria's Sakhalin II project to add 400 million barrels of oil equivalent to the company's reserves, President Victor Beghini said Thursday.

That is equal to 40 percent of the company's present proven reserves, he told analysts attending PaineWebber's Annual Energy Conference. Marathon's partners there are the Royal Dutch/Shell Group, Mitsui & Co Ltd and McDermott International Inc, who have 20 percent each; and Mitsubishi Oil Co Ltd with 10 pct.
Noting Phase I has begun in a multi-phase development of the Sakhalin II project, Beghini said production licenses have been granted and first oil is targeted to flow by mid-1999.
"The field will produce 90,000 gross barrels per day in ice free months, or 45,000 barrels per day on average in a year by 2000," he said.
